entry.title: The pirate drawings of 1922
entry.content:
Yesterday I posted a ship in a bottle from the 1922 book “Pirates,” and today I’ve had a chance to clean up a few more images, including most of the actual named pirates described in the book. The book seems to be scanned on a setting for text, and so the pictures require just a little bit of correction and cleaning. I’m pretty happy with the way these images turned out. Of course, since the book was released in 1922, all of these are in the public domain. So if you need a pirate drawing, go ahead.

[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/majorstedebonnet-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/majorstedebonnet/)
Major Stede Bonnet
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/captwilliamkid-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/captwilliamkid/)
Captain William Kid
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/captavery-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/captavery/)
Captain Avery
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/captjohngow-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/captjohngow/)
Captain John Gow
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/captjohnrackham-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/captjohnrackham/)
Captain John Rackham
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/captteach-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/captteach/)
Captain Teach
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/pirateship-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/pirateship/)
A pirate ship at sea
[![](https://parkerhiggins.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/shipinabottle1-150x150.png)](https://parkerhiggins.net/2013/05/the-pirate-drawings-of-1922/shipinabottle-2/)
Ship in a bottle
entry.summary: Yesterday I posted a ship in a bottle from the 1922 book “Pirates,” and today I’ve had a chance to clean up a few more images, including most of the actual named pirates described in the book. The book seems to be scanned on a setting for text, and so the pictures require just a little bit of correction and cleaning. I’m pretty happy with the way these images turned out. Of course, since the book was released in 1922, all of these are in the public domain. So if you need a pirate drawing, go ahead.

entry.title: Ship in a bottle
entry.content: I cleaned up this illustration from a scan of the title page of Pirates (1922). The illustrator is the great Claud Lovat Fraser. The book came out the year after he died.
